definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: Some incidents did end in violence, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然有些事件最终演变成了恶斗。

sentences.english: After a fierce fight, Robin killed Guy.
sentences.chinese: 经过一番恶斗，罗宾汉杀死了盖伊。

sentences.english: A bigger crowd, in other words, was more likely to suppress a fight.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，人越多，越有可能抑制一场恶斗。

sentences.english: The badger and the snake had a ferocious battle in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 獾和蛇在树林里进行了一场恶斗。

sentences.english: Lin was explicitly, yellow rate with baylor scattered on armed.
sentences.chinese: 林被罢官，黄率民团与贝勒展开恶斗。

sentences.english: There is a very serious fight going on in Ukraine between government forces and rebels.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰政府军和反对派正在恶斗。

sentences.english: Two battles evil, life and death Competing, naturally climax of the film office.
sentences.chinese: 两恶恶斗，生死相搏，自是本片最高潮之处。

sentences.english: No one wants bloody fights, so they keep their prizes.
sentences.chinese: 大家都不想血腥恶斗，所以他们会保住战利品。

sentences.english: We'll face a tough fight in the upcoming election.
sentences.chinese: 在即将到来的选举中，我们将面临一场恶斗。

sentences.english: Then one night there was a fight right out on Tremont Street.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，在华埠街上发生了一场恶斗。

definition: lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to fight with all one's might
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
to fight or argue on a blogging site (netspeak)
